chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan J Rodriguez Villegas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan J Rodriguez Villegas in court.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening appeared by video for Juan J Rodriguez Villegas.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Alberto Aguilar. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Juan J Rodriguez Villegas in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan J Rodriguez Villegas in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan J Rodriguez Villegas in court with Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening; both appear by video.  Stephanie Krueger appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.    Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi by video.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Cudahy Sgt S. Harrington. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Juan J Rodriguez Villegas in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Juan J Rodriguez Villegas in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan J Rodriguez Villegas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
